medical_history.chief_complaint: Gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) with Barrett esophagus.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Mrs. J initially developed symptoms of heartburn in the early 1990s. Symptoms persisted throughout the day and night, worsening after eating spicy foods. Initially treated with ranitidine without improvement; switched to omeprazole which controlled symptoms for six years but returned after discontinuation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Long history of gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) and documented Barrett esophagus. Mild degenerative arthritis. Allergy to penicillin. 40 pack-year smoking history; quit in the late 1980s. Currently on hormone replacement therapy with conjugated estrogens and progesterone.
medical_history.family_history: Mother is alive and well; father died of lung cancer.
medical_history.social_history: Lives near Boston with husband; has two grown children. Exercises regularly; consumes one glass of wine in the evening without worsening symptoms.
